snippet: For Mayor Bill de Blasio, who has staked his administration on battling inequality, dealing with what seems to be a growing homelessness problem is as much about social reform as political survival.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio is set to unveil $22 million mental health initiative, which he says will include provisions to help homeless people; contends that rising homelessness, issue for which he has been widely criticized, is symptom of city's growing inequality.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and NIKITA STEWART

lead_paragraph: For Mayor Bill de Blasio, who has staked his administration on battling inequality, dealing with what seems to be a growing homelessness problem is as much about social reform as political survival.

headline.main: De Blasio, Facing Criticism, Is Taking On Homelessness With $22 Million Initiative
headline.print_headline: De Blasio, Facing Criticism, Is Taking On Homelessness
